item.title: Perfecting the Friends List
item.dc:creator: @try_again try again
item.description:
@try_again wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:9, topic:231043”]The server is the problem you idiots, not the client. Its because the parameter Node-ID is the World that the client thinks its connecting to, but with 9 added to it. So just set the Node-ID to 10 when starting the client, and then sending world 0 for offline won’t crash the client, and everything works perfectly, even the messages.

The only modification I made was a packet to change the Node-ID while the client was running. For example, if someone using my client goes on world 2, it sends a packet to change the node ID to 11. 11-9=2. Now people in World-2 are green and at the top! :rolleyes:

It worked when RS was on 317, why the heck did you think the client needed editing? And with this tutorial you can’t have multiple worlds, which I have. Plus my friends list works even if players are on different worlds, through a login server:

[/quote]

It worked didn’t it…?

Read full topic

item.title: Perfecting the Friends List
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

The server is the problem you idiots, not the client. Its because the parameter Node-ID is the World that the client thinks its connecting to, but with 9 added to it. So just set the Node-ID to 10 when starting the client, and then sending world 0 for offline won’t crash the client, and everything works perfectly, even the messages.

The only modification I made was a packet to change the Node-ID while the client was running. For example, if someone using my client goes on world 2, it sends a packet to change the node ID to 11. 11-9=2. Now people in World-2 are green and at the top! :rolleyes:

It worked when RS was on 317, why the heck did you think the client needed editing? And with this tutorial you can’t have multiple worlds, which I have. Plus my friends list works even if players are on different worlds, through a login server:

friends.jpg766×527

Read full topic

item.title: Perfecting the Friends List
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

Here i will show you how to correct the friends list perfectly for a non-renamed 317 client. This includes:

  • [iurl=#world]Getting rid of “World - 1” and “World - 8”[/iurl]
  • [iurl=#onoff]Fixing the online / offline messages[/iurl]
  • [iurl=#online]Making it so that the online users are at the top of the list.[/iurl]

[anchor=world]Getting rid of “World - 1” and “World - 8”

First find this in your main class:

if(anIntArray826[j] == 0) class9.aString248 = "@red@Offline"; else if(anIntArray826[j] == anInt957) class9.aString248 = "@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9); else class9.aString248 = "@yel@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9); class9.anInt217 = 1; return; }

The block of code here

if(anIntArray826[j] == 0) class9.aString248 = "@red@Offline";

Would declare that if the player is offline the red word “Offline” would appear next to the name. Although this has not been correctly declared, that is why we get the “World - 8” when someone if offline. To declare it simply change the number 0 here

if(anIntArray826[j] == 0)

to the number 1 like this

if(anIntArray826[j] == 1)

Now we need to get rid of the “World - 1”. Underneath the offline block of code you will see the word “else”, this means that if they are not offline it will take you to the next method which is this.

if(anIntArray826[j] == anInt957) class9.aString248 = "@gre@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9);

Here it displays that if the user is online it will display the green “World - 1”.

The piece of code here

(anIntArray826[j] - 9)

Looks for the world the user is in, but because we have not declared the different type of worlds it is defaulted to world 1. So what we are going to do is remove that and change the word “world-” to make it look like this

if(anIntArray826[j] == anInt957) class9.aString248 = "@gre@Online";

and we are going to do the same for the last line by changing it from this

                class9.aString248 = "@yel@World-" + (anIntArray826[j] - 9);

which shows the yellow “World - 8”. To this

                class9.aString248 = "@gre@Online";

[anchor=onoff]Fixing the online / offline messages

Find this in your main class

if(l4 != aLongArray955[k24]) continue; if(anIntArray826[k24] != i18) { anIntArray826[k24] = i18; aBoolean1153 = true; if(i18 > 0) method77(s7 + " has logged in.", 5, "", aBoolean991); if(i18 == 0) method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, "", aBoolean991); } s7 = null; break; }

In the following code it would declare to send the message “Player name (s7) has logged in” if it was declared properly.

if(i18 > 0) method77(s7 + " has logged in.", 5, "", aBoolean991);

The same goes for the "Player name (s7) has logged out code.

if(i18 == 0) method77(s7 + " has logged out.", 5, "", aBoolean991);

All we need to do to declare it correctly is correct the integers here

if(i18 > 0)

and here

if(i18 == 0)

by changing the 0’s to 1’s.

[anchor=online]Making it so that the online users are at the top of the list

In your main class find this void

public final void init() { try { anInt957 = 0; anInt958 = 0; method52(false); aBoolean959 = true; signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); method2(503, false, 765); } catch(Exception exception) { return; } }

Again doing this is just a matter of declaring the right integer. The anInt we are looking at is anInt957, where we just need to change the 0

            anInt957 = 0;

to a 10

            anInt957 = 10;

Now we to do the same thing to the anInt957 in the following void

public static void main(String args[]) { try { System.out.println("Loading RuneScape..."); System.out.println("317 Deob, improved by Scarecrows"); anInt957 = 0; anInt958 = 0; method52(false); aBoolean959 = true; signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); jframe = new Jframe(args); return; } catch(Exception exception) { return; } }

Change the 0

            anInt957 = 0;

to a 10

            anInt957 = 10;

Thats all, if i missed anything please notify me and note that i may type this tutorial up again for the renamed 317 client. Although the concept for the renamed is the same.

Read full topic
